data.title: Wonderful Stay
data.text:
We were much in need of a peaceful getaway and this hotel did not disappoint. We stay at the crown plaza in ventura often and the room here was bigger and nicer! Plus the people, esp the manager Todd, who went out of his way to assist and make sure our stay was just lovely. Frankly they were the best of any hotel I've ever been to! 
However, if you have difficulty walking this hotel might be a bit too strenuous as it is a ways to the pool (which is small), and it's downhill to go most places around town and a big hill to go up on the way back!

data.title: Dog friendly!!
data.text: The main reason we chose this hotel was due to the fact that it was dog friendly and we could use our reward nights here with IHG. Hotel was clean and we had a really good stay. We looked out to the beach side. It was close enough to go to Disney and Legoland. We really only slept there and was out in the day.

data.title: Great Location, But Not Worth 300 Plus a Night!!
data.text:
This is my second stay at this Holiday Inn and I was rather disappointed this time!
We stayed during Memorial Day weekend and booked  the King Jacuzzi Suite, during the holiday weekend mark up it was 240 a night, this time it was 305 a night, and it wasn't even a holiday!!!
I stuck with my reservation because of the great location, in the heart of San Clemente, just a few steps away from Pizza Port, a must try spot in San Clemente, but next time I will stick to the less expensive Best Western or Travelodge.

Even though I booked the King Jacuzzi Suite again this time, the room was not the same as the one we got a few months ago, for less money. This one was much smaller, and did not contain a wet bar that the previous one had. The balcony was about half the size as well. As if that wasn't disappointing enough, the Jacuzzi looked like it hadn't been cleaned in a while and the room had a major humidity issue! I couldn't even fix my hair in the morning, major frizz drama! I set the AC to high and nada, you could set up an orchid green house in there! 
They don't even offer free breakfast here. You would think with more profits than an oil company, they could afford to shell out some frozen hash browns and powdered eggs, geeeze!
I tried to make the best of my morning before checkout, and I made my way to the pool, which you have to walk through the parking garage to get to, awkward!
It opened at 9am, I went over at 9:15 and it looked like it hadn't been cleaned in days!!
There were empty cups around the hot tub, which was filled with sand, grime and spiders, eeeeeew, The green hue of the water didn't make it any more welcoming.
The pool was just as bad, filled with tons of leaves, dried flowers and bugs. It was also  a lovely 35 degrees below zero, guess they can't afford heating either!
It was definitely not worth soooo much money to stay at this place, if you are going to charge that much, your hotel better be above and beyond the customer's expectations!

Save your dinero and stay at the Best Western Casa Blanca instead!

owner_response.author: IHGService, Guest Relations Manager at Holiday Inn San Clemente, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Adri C,

Thank you for taking the time to leave a review of our property. We strive to provide the best possible experience and it is great to read from our guests on how we are doing. We would like to apologize for the overall dissatisfaction you had experienced during your stay. It is certainly not our intent to inconvenience our valued customers, but to instead provide good value, comfortable, clean and friendly accommodations. Your feedback is of great importance to us and allows us to monitor and improve our service continually.

Although we were not able to exceed or at least be at par with your expectations, we hope you give us a chance to change your perception of our hotel.

Sincerely,

Connie D
Case Manager
IHGService
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Decent if You Don't Mind Sleeping on a Freeway
data.text: This is an average hotel that works hard to be above average.  My experience was not the best since I was on the second floor with view of the freeway and sound effects to go along.  The room was spacious and clean.  It had many details of an upscale hotel such as separate sitting area, desk, room refrigerator, safe and even room slippers.  The shower was very old and I had to call the front desk to explain how to turn on the valve.  The front desk was very nice and professional and handled check in and check out quickly and pleasantly.  I did not see the pool or rest areas so can not comment there.  I  was told there was a restaurant that closed at 10 pm.  When I ordered breakfast instead, it arrived promptly and I received a 15 minute alert call they were coming up.  The food was very mediocre but warm so I was grateful to have something.  When I took a morning stroll to my car, the police were inside a nearby guest suite that was in big disarray and the guest inside was being questioned, distraught and obiously in the midst of some trauma.  I did not get the impression this was a very upscale environment but at least it was safe and management was on top of things.  The parking was free and ample with good access to local shops and, of course, the freeway.  Overall, a decent but average hotel that provides good amenities with good staff.  I would visit again if the price was attractive.

owner_response.author: IHGService, Guest Relations Manager at Holiday Inn San Clemente, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear Travelinslo,

Thank you for taking a moment to tell us about your experience at our property. We rely on guest feedback as this will allow us to improve wherever possible. I appreciate your kind words towards our hotel staff. It is indeed heartwarming when a valued guest takes the time to acknowledge the passion and effort that our customer service team put every day. I am also glad that you liked your room accommodations. On the other hand, I am sorry for the disappointments you had with the food served and regret the inconvenience the freeway noise may have caused you. Your comments are valued and noted and be rest assured that these will be shared with our management team to help us determine what we could further improve on to be able to deliver a highly satisfactory experience.

Until your next visit, we remain at your service.

Sincerely,

Ingrid V.
Case Manager
IHGService
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Dog Friendly Hotel
data.text: Finding a good hotel that's dog friendly and doesn't charge a crazy fee is tough to do at the beach. This place is now our go-to spot for a San Clemente getaway. Great location- everything in downtown SC is within walking distance, and clean rooms with views and/or balconies are very reasonable. We've stayed here several times and keep coming back!

data.title: cool place!
data.text:
really nice place! Got some great directions from Chance Mccoy.
beautiful area, great staff, next to the beach. what more can you ask for! would reccomend you to stay. great weekend getaway. rooms are clean

data.title: Pleasantly surprised
data.text: I booked this resort just to stay a night with my wife and 2 babies (2 year old and 3 month old) to make the drive shorter to our final destination to San Diego from San Fernando Valley on Sunday night using IHG points.  I was pleasantly surprised by the location of the resort which was a few blocks from a street called Del Mar and the pier.  Del Mar street was awesome and the pier was just awesome.  The resort staff were friendly as well as the guests that stayed there that night.  The resort had a small and cozy feel to it and the laundry room was very nice as it was free and readily accessible.  This resort is definitely not the oceanfront honeymoon resort and i dont think it claims to be, but it is a very nice resort to stay for the night.  It is clean and you will be pleasantly surprised by all that there is around the resort.  Breakfast is not provided for free here as does other IHG hotels do but there are plenty of good restaurants near by to get a better experience.  I would definitely recommend this place if you are staying the night with a family.

data.title: AWESOME AND PERFECT
data.text:
Had been curious about this facility, on previous visits to SC. When I arrived, I was given an "ocen view'. complimentary upgrade!. Which really set up whole mood, and general morale up several knotches!   a vert clean an large room. The balcony was over a portion of the main hotel entrance. At night it was very quiet, no noise whatsoever. even with the I5 right up againt the other side of the building. 
Nicely built, with the stucco inside the hallway walls. reminded me of other Holiday Inns. Very nice place. Just steps from PCH?El camino and the pier.

data.title: Nice Hotel and great location.
data.text: Took daughter to San Clemente for her birthday. After checking different hotel decided on Holiday Inn. Glad we did. It was nice easy to find and in a great location. Only down fall I saw was no breakfast included but I am glad that did not change my mind. It is in downtown area off the freeway but does not feel like it is. It is kind of tucked away on a side street off the main drag so easy to get to everywhere. We decided to venture out and walk to the pier. It was about a mile but a really nice walk through the quaint downtown. We stopped for sushi and then for dinner down at the pier. Oyster Bar has a Happy Hour menu and on a cool April night the clam chowder in a bread bowl was perfect. We sat out on the patio  and then walked back up. Stopped at a little bar near hotel and played pool and darts before walking back up to room. Was one of the nicest little towns we have been in awhile and felt totally safe. Everything well lit and lots of people walking around. We will come again.

data.title: Spacious and clean rooms
data.text: This was a great pick. Within 1km walk to the beach, the rooms were generous in size and very clean with all the amenities you would expect from Holiday Inn. We stayed here for a wedding and our party took approximately 30 rooms - it was impressive how well they managed to cater for us in the midst of an obviously fully booked hotel. The complimentary car park was good value too. The only negative would be traffic noise at the back of the property (half of the rooms face this way...). If we were to stay again I'd request a beach facing room as it was a little hard to get to sleep with the noise in our room.

data.title: Great service, treated us very well - question over hot water pressure
data.text: Stayed here for my brother's wedding (along with at least 20-30 in our group) and found the staff extremely accomodating as we basically took over half their hotel.  I even rang them shortly before needing to leave for the wedding with a dire need for scissors and the front desk staff ran it straight up for me which was greatly appreciated.  Didn't get a room with a view but spent time in rooms that did have views and they were really stunning.  Also very short walking distance to town as well as 10-15 minutes from beach and pier.  The only downside is that the hot water pressure in the shower was quite weak but everything else was perfect!

data.title: Spring break get away
data.text: Had a great stay in San Clemente.  The staff was very accommodating. They were genuinely concerned that my family and I had a great stay.  I'm a Platinum member and they made sure that I was upgraded to a beach facing room. The room was clean and comfortable. I have to mention Laura, Sheila and Bethany as the super helpful staff. Laura answered all my questions. The hotel is close to the freeway, but rooms are very quiet. Missed having the complimentary breakfast, but the restaurant was convenient none the less. The size of the room is much larger than the HI Express rooms on the north end on town. We liked being closer to the beach too.

data.title: Great Hotel
data.text: We had a fabulous stay, we booked rooms which where at the back of the hotel, but we managed to get moved to the front which are better rooms and have a balcony, which I would recommend,thank you to the staff who moved us with no fuss and where very helpful and friendly, there are some nice bars and restaurants just a couple of minutes walk, the people are so nice ,we also had lunch at the peer, which has great food and views. A great stop over for us.

data.title: Amazing Property by the Beach
data.text: San Clemente is a beautiful and relaxing town in south Orange County, and there is no better place to stay and visit than Holiday Inn San Clemente.  The staff is attentive and greeted us warmly upon check in.  We were pleasantly surprised to find out we had been upgraded to a suite with jacuzzi and a balcony with ocean view.  Parking was plentiful at the property.  It was steps away from the main street, and within walking distance from the beach and pier area.  The cleaning staff was friendly and courteous.  I had the perfect staycation at this property and would highly recommend this property to anyone who is looking to stay in the area.

data.title: Great Value
data.text: I stayed here a week while attending a training session. I had trouble with my credit card at check in. The staff was very patient and accommodating while I worked it out. The rooms are clean and well maintained. Its walking  distance to restaurants, and shopping and nightlife. Its a 15 minute walk to the pier and beach. I will be returning for a family trip someday and we will happily stay here again!

data.title: An amazing hotel and great workers.
data.text: I recently stayed here, and I loved it. It was a beautiful hotel and the employees there were great. One employee in particular that made my stay here so great was Mitch, he did an amazing job and making my stay wonderful. Thank you!

owner_response.author: Troy M, Manager at Holiday Inn San Clemente, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Cody W,
Thank you for kind words about our hotel and our staff. We hope to see you again in the future.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: San Clemente Holiday Inn
data.text: I was apprehensive about the location at first since it was near the freeway; however, we discovered the property to be quiet. The five stars are for how pleasantly surprised we were with the comfort and cleanliness of the hotel in general and the very friendly clerk, Mitch, who directed us to a great local restaurant nearby named La Siesta. We recommend this hotel and the quaint town of San Clemente to others.

owner_response.author: Troy M, Manager at Holiday Inn San Clemente, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Locarte,
Thank you so much for your review of our hotel. I am pleased to hear you enjoyed your stay with us. It's something our staff takes great pride in, so we value your feedback. We hope you will visit us again.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Great Hotel!
data.text: Upon arriving, my family and I were extremely fatigued and in dire need of a nap when we arrived in California. We were greeted kindly and asked if we needed anything else before we walked up into our room. We noticed our room was a bit noisy due to our neighbors on the floor above us. The hotel immediately took the situation into their own hands and moved us into a new room and took care of the noisy guests. We were able to get a great nights rest and the trip was awesome because of it! Love this hotel. I would definitely recommend.

data.title: Awesome staff!!!
data.text: I really enjoyed my stay here and it was thanks to the staff. Laura, who checked me in, was very sweet. Then, i had breakfast and met Iraj who was also very Nice and helpful! I don't go to San Clemente much, but when i do i'll know where to stay.

owner_response.author: Troy M, Manager at Holiday Inn San Clemente, responded to this review
owner_response.text: Thank you so much for your review of our hotel. I am pleased to hear you enjoyed your stay with us and that Laura and Iraj were helpful. Our customer service something our staff takes great pride in, so we value your feedback. We hope you will visit us again.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Experience with reservation staff at Hotel
data.text:
Tones matter to a customer!
"It's Turner" was the response "have a a good day" and slam of the phone. The tone certainly did not indicate I was being wished a good day and Turner did not correct me the first time that I had mistakenly called him Trevor. He however was quick to correct me that his name was Turner when I indicated to him I didn't agree to his reason on why I got a rate different than the corporate rate promised for the reservation I had made.
Tones matter to a customer, and it doesn't take much to keep an even tone even if the customer has a different point of view. You can just agree to disagree with the customer and could have been a better customer experience than the one I received. I hope my stay will be better than my phone experience with Turner

owner_response.author: IHGCare, Guest Relations Manager at Holiday Inn San Clemente, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Dear SherylPinto,

We appreciate you taking the time to comment about your recent stay at our hotel. We always strive to provide great service to all of our guests, however, on this occasion, we sincerely apologize the lack of customer service received which fell below of your expectations. Your comments are being reviewed by the hotel management, and appropriate actions will be taken to ensure the same situation will not happen again.

Once again, thank you for your feedback and hope this will not deter you from giving us opportunities to make your stay as pleasant as possible.

Sincerely,

Divina P.
Case Manager
IHGCare
owner_response.title: Owner Response
